application.controller

Class EntryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.controller.EntryController

  • public class EntryController
extends java.lang.Object
    Serves as the controller for the edit entry view of the program. Allows user to compose and edit an entry, as well as save it to a file. Also provides option for motivational pop-up, and allows user to log out or quit the program.
    Author:
    Kisa Burnett, Matthew Darragh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EntryController()

      void backToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Switches to the main menu scene from button, passing the file with the list of journal entries back.

      Switches to the main menu scene from menu bar, passing the file with the list of journal entries back.
      boolean checkForSave()
      Checks if the entry text has changed since the last save and pops up an alert if it has.
      void editEntry(java.lang.String fileName)
      Pulls up an existing entry for the user to view and edit.

      Pulls a motivational quote from a Motivation object and displays it to the user.

      Pulls up a blank form for the user to work in and save.

      • editEntry

        public void editEntry(java.lang.String fileName)
        Pulls up an existing entry for the user to view and edit.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String name of the file to be worked on by this controller.

      • newEntry

        public void newEntry()
        Pulls up a blank form for the user to work in and save.

      • backToMain

        public void backToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException
        Switches to the main menu scene from button, passing the file with the list of journal entries back. Separate from backToMainMenuBar because the menu item elements must be pulled from the menu bar.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent the event triggering the function (in this case, a mouse click).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file doesn't exist.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the scene switch fails.

      • backToMainMenuBar

        public void backToMainMenuBar(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Switches to the main menu scene from menu bar, passing the file with the list of journal entries back. Separate from backToMain because the menu item elements must be pulled from the menu bar.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent the event triggering the function (in this case, a mouse click).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file doesn't exist.

      • saveEntry

        public void saveEntry(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the current form contents to the files containing entry titles and entry text.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent the event triggering the function (in this case, a mouse click).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file doesn't exist.

      • setEntryData

        public void setEntryData(FileManager user)
        Passes the user data to this scene from another scene.
        Parameters:
        user - FileManager object containing the current user's entry information.

      • motivateEdit

        public void motivateEdit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Pulls a motivational quote from a Motivation object and displays it to the user.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent the event triggering the function (in this case, a mouse click).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file doesn't exist.

      • checkForSave

        public boolean checkForSave()
        Checks if the entry text has changed since the last save and pops up an alert if it has.
        Returns:
        boolean whether or not the text has changed, and if it should be saved.
